original_text: In summary, we have developed a technique for site-specific nanowire size reduction by FIB thinning. Transmission electron microscope images of a thinned tungsten composite nanowire with width reduced from 80 to 20nm show uniform shrinking along the length of the wire and high resolution images show no obvious changes of the morphology after thinning. The critical current density of the as-deposited wire and one thinned to a width of 50nm is 1.7×105 and 1.4×105A/cm2 at 4.26K, respectively, suggesting insignificant modulation of the electrical properties during thinning. These results suggest that FIB-milling is a potential approach for controllable size reduction with high resolution towards the observation of size- and quantum effects, as well as for construction of 3D superconducting nanodevices.
original_translation: En resumen, hemos desarrollado una técnica para la reducción del tamaño de nanocables en sitios específicos mediante el adelgazamiento por FIB. Las imágenes del microscopio electrónico de transmisión de un nanohilo compuesto de tungsteno adelgazado, con un ancho reducido de 80 a 20 nm, muestran un encogimiento uniforme a lo largo del alambre y las imágenes de alta resolución no muestran cambios obvios en la morfología después del adelgazamiento. La densidad de corriente crítica del alambre depositado y uno adelgazado a un ancho de 50 nm es de 1.7×105 y 1.4×105 A/cm2 a 4.26K, respectivamente, lo que sugiere una modulación insignificante de las propiedades eléctricas durante el adelgazamiento. Estos resultados sugieren que el fresado FIB es un enfoque potencial para la reducción de tamaño controlada con alta resolución hacia la observación de efectos de tamaño y cuánticos, así como para la construcción de nanodispositivos superconductores en 3D.

Transmission electron microscope images of a thinned tungsten composite nanowire with width reduced from 80 to 20nm show uniform shrinking along the length of the wire and high resolution images show no obvious changes of the morphology after thinning.

The critical current density of the as-deposited wire and one thinned to a width of 50nm is 1.7×105 and 1.4×105A/cm2 at 4.26K, respectively, suggesting insignificant modulation of the electrical properties during thinning.

These results suggest that FIB-milling is a potential approach for controllable size reduction with high resolution towards the observation of size- and quantum effects, as well as for construction of 3D superconducting nanodevices.

original_annotated_sentences:
In summary, we have developed a technique for
site-specific nanowire size reduction
by FIB thinning.

Transmission electron microscope images of a thinned tungsten composite nanowire with width reduced from 80 to 20nm show uniform shrinking along the length of the wire and high resolution images show no obvious changes of the morphology after thinning.

The critical current density of the as-deposited wire and one thinned to a width of 50nm is 1.7×105 and 1.4×105A/cm2 at 4.26K, respectively, suggesting insignificant modulation of the electrical properties during thinning.

These results suggest that FIB-milling is a potential approach for controllable size reduction with high resolution towards the observation of size- and quantum effects, as well as for construction of 3D superconducting nanodevices.

Transmission electron microscope images.translated_key: Imágenes del microscopio electrónico de transmisión
original_annotated_sentences: In summary, we have developed a technique for site-specific nanowire size reduction by FIB thinning.

Transmission electron microscope images
of a thinned tungsten composite nanowire with width reduced from 80 to 20nm show uniform shrinking along the length of the wire and high resolution images show no obvious changes of the morphology after thinning.

The critical current density of the as-deposited wire and one thinned to a width of 50nm is 1.7×105 and 1.4×105A/cm2 at 4.26K, respectively, suggesting insignificant modulation of the electrical properties during thinning.

These results suggest that FIB-milling is a potential approach for controllable size reduction with high resolution towards the observation of size- and quantum effects, as well as for construction of 3D superconducting nanodevices.

Transmission electron microscope images.translated_text:
En resumen, hemos desarrollado una técnica para la reducción del tamaño de nanocables en sitios específicos mediante el adelgazamiento por FIB. Output:
Imágenes del microscopio electrónico de transmisión
de un nanohilo compuesto de tungsteno adelgazado con un ancho reducido de 80 a 20 nm muestran un encogimiento uniforme a lo largo de la longitud del hilo y las imágenes de alta resolución no muestran cambios obvios en la morfología después del adelgazamiento. La densidad de corriente crítica del alambre depositado y uno adelgazado a un ancho de 50 nm es de 1.7×105 y 1.4×105 A/cm2 a 4.26K, respectivamente, lo que sugiere una modulación insignificante de las propiedades eléctricas durante el adelgazamiento. Estos resultados sugieren que el fresado FIB es un enfoque potencial para la reducción de tamaño controlada con alta resolución hacia la observación de efectos de tamaño y cuánticos, así como para la construcción de nanodispositivos superconductores en 3D.
